metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3867 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: [ksmbd: add missing compound request handing in some commands] It was discovered that the KSMBD implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle session setup requests, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A remote attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> also known as ZDI-23-981, ZDI-CAN-21355 needs ksmbd-tools installed to enable the service, which is not installed by default.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
